snippet: The Institute for Supply Management’s report measuring growth in industries that cover most of the work force indicated fewer new orders and a modest drop-off in overall activity.
abstract: Institute of Supply Management says that its index of nonmanufacturing activity dropped to 55.2 in January, down from 55.7 in December, which was the highest level in nearly a year; any reading above 50 indicates expansion, providing a bright sign for the economy.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management’s report measuring growth in industries that cover most of the work force indicated fewer new orders and a modest drop-off in overall activity.

headline.seo: I.S.M. Reports Slower Growth at Services Companies
headline.main: Service Companies’ Growth Slowed Slightly in January
headline.print_headline: Service Companies’ Growth Slowed Slightly in January
